qas.question: What has been a prime motivation in astronomy and navigation?
Periodic events and periodic motion have served as standards for what?
What is the current international unit of time?
The electronic transition frequency of which element defines the second?
Time has personal value due to awareness of it's limited nature in what?

answers.text: each day and in human life spans

qas.question: What groups have been occupied by understanding the life span of humans?
How important is a strong economy considered?

plausible_answers.text: measuring the electronic transition frequency of caesium atoms

qas.question: How do you define the method used for tracking heartbeats?
What do caesium atoms affect to make them shorter?
Why do scientists want to study caesium atoms?
What has been a prime motivation in units of time?
What have periodic events and transition frequency have served as standards for?
What is the current national unit of time?

plausible_answers.text: due to an awareness of the limited time in each day and in human life spans

qas.question: Why does time have international value?

plausible_answers.text: apparent motion of the sun across the sky, the phases of the moon, the swing of a pendulum, and the beat of a heart

qas.question: What is an example of a technologist?

Time is also of <b6_0>significant social importance<b6_0/>, having <b9_0>economic value<b9_0/> ("time is money") as well as personal value, <b13_0>due to an awareness of the limited time in <a4_0>each day and in <b8_0>human life spans<b13_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/>.
